isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Assembly - MTC-4208 and -4210 Rear Output Shaft End Play Adjustment

svcproc.title: MTC-4208 and -4210 Rear Output Shaft End Play Adjustment

note.para: Determine rear output shaft bearing end play before final assembly. Seals should not be installed until end plays are set.

step1.para: Install the rear output shaft yoke. Tighten the yoke nut to 200 lb-ft (271 Nm).
Rotate the output shaft several times to seat the bearings.
Use a dial indicator to check output shaft bearing end play. Center the dial indicator over the shaft using a ball bearing for accuracy (Figure 50).

figure.caption: Figure 50. Center Dial Indicator Over Shaft

step1.para: Use a pry bar to lift the yoke to obtain a measurement. To obtain a consistent and averaged reading, perform this operation two or three times. Record the reading for this shaft.

item.para:
If the end play reading is greater than 0.001- to 0.005-inch (0.025-0.127 mm):
Add shims to reduce end play.
If the end play reading is less than specification: Remove shims to increase end play. Bearing shims come in 0.003-, 0.005- and 0.010-inch (0.08, 0.13 and 0.25 mm) thicknesses.

step1.para: If rear output shaft bearing end play requires adjustment, remove the rear output shaft yoke so that the case and cover can be easily separated.
Measure end play on the remaining shafts before splitting the case to make adjustments.
After performing rear output shaft bearing end play measurement, separate the transfer case halves as necessary to adjust shims and achieve correct end play on the shaft requiring adjustment.
Adjust shims to achieve the correct bearing end play on all shafts as required. Refer to Shim Assembly in this section.
